question.title: What is the primary indication for hospitalization without consent in children under 18 years old?
question.description: Select the correct answer from the options below.

option_a.title: Severe acute illness requiring immediate medical attention
option_a.description: A life-threatening medical condition that requires immediate hospitalization.

option_b.title: Mental health crisis requiring hospitalization
option_b.description: A psychiatric emergency that requires hospitalization for stabilization.

option_c.title: Severe allergic reaction or anaphylaxis
option_c.description: A severe allergic reaction that requires immediate medical attention.

option_d.title: Family refusal of treatment
option_d.description: A situation where the parents or guardians refuse medical treatment for a child.

correct_option.title: None of the above
correct_option.description: The correct answer is not listed above.
